attributes.action: Adequate protection & COVID 19 testing for residential care homes & care staff.
attributes.additional_details:
Support Residential care homes and social care with the proper PPE and testing kits.

Put regulations in place to help stop the spread of the virus within these care homes.

Protect the care staff and their families.
attributes.background:
Adequate protection & testing for residential care homes & staff.
Residents testing positive for Covid 19 are allowed to spread the virus to other residents without strict regulations in place to stop this.
Staff are allowed to come in & out of the homes with no proper PPE & no testing available.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action: 

Make Covid-19 test kits available to all care homes, for the residents and staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312785

Provide urgent support and PPE to carers during coronavirus crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312960

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
